newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan Int'l Airline to expand cargo.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan Int'l Airline to expand cargo.

text.p: State-run Pakistan International Airline (PIA) said on Monday it planned to expand its cargo service with leased planes.

"The airline is planning to lease DC-8 stretch freighter aircraft to supplement our existing capacity so that the airline could retrieve market share," Nawaz Tiwana, PIA's managing director, told Reuters in an interview.
He did not say how many DC-8s would be acquired under the plan, which he described as an "interim arrangement".
He said cargo service was a weak area for PIA and a marketing task force was being created to improve it.
"I think market share in the past three or four years has unfortunately gone down," he added.
PIA now has just two cargo planes, ageing Boeing 707s. "We have in principle decided to scrap this fleet," Tiwana said.
